file_name: clickstreamcorp_20200330_1-a_ex1a-6 mat ctrct_12089935_ex1a-6 mat ctrct_development agreement.pdf

perturbation.original_text: Client has the unilateral right to cancel this agreement at any time within a 7-day notice period. Further, Developer can only cancel due to lack of payment. Client will have a 30 day right to cure before a cancelation can occur.
perturbation.changed_text: Client has the unilateral right to cancel this agreement at any time within a 7-day notice period. Further, Developer can only cancel due to lack of payment. Client will have a 10 day right to cure before a cancelation can occur.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates an in-text contradiction by modifying the cure period the client has before the developer can cancel. One section specifies a 30-day cure period, while the other now specifies a 10-day cure period, creating ambiguity about the correct duration. This could lead to disputes about when the developer is entitled to cancel the agreement.

perturbation.original_text: The developer will fix any bugs that may come up from the original contract after the 90 days warranty has passed.
perturbation.changed_text: The developer will fix any bugs that may come up from the original contract after the 30 days warranty has passed.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text creates an in-text contradiction by changing the period from which the developer fixes bugs after the original contract. One section specifies a 90-day warranty period, while the other specifies a 30-day warranty period, creating ambiguity about the correct duration. This could lead to disputes about the period which the developer will support.

perturbation.original_text: Mobile / Web App development: 24 weeks + 4 weeks for QA & Details.
perturbation.changed_text: Mobile / Web App development: 24 weeks + 8 weeks for QA & Details.
perturbation.explanation: The modified text creates an in-text contradiction by changing the weeks from which the QA and Details are completed. One section specifies a 4 week QA process, while the other specifies an 8-week QA process, creating ambiguity about the correct duration. This could lead to disputes about the date of delivery.
